SourceText:
At the end of the day, take a minute to: 

* Talk to your teen about one fun thing they did. 
* Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
* You are a star!
text:
Ekupheleni kosuku, thatha umzuzu ukuze: 

* Uncokole nomntwana wakho ngento enye emnandi ayenzileyo. 
* UzIncome ngokwenza into enye kakuhle namhlanje. 
*Uligqala!

SourceText:
* Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
* Ask each other, “What difficulty did you face today?”
* Ask each other, “How can I help you?”
* Try to do this together every day; it could be when you are eating dinner together or before you go to bed.
text:
* Buzanani, “Yintoni ekwenze wonwaba namhlanje?”
* Buzanani, “Yeyiphi ingxaki oye wanayo namhlanje?”
* Buzanani, “Ndingakunceda njani?”
* Zamani ukwenza le nto nonke yonke imihla; ninokuyenza xa nisitya kunye isidlo sangokuhlwa okanye ngaphambi kokulala.

SourceText:
* You can’t always travel, but you can always dream! Ask your teen these questions:
* Where would you want to travel to? How long would you be away? What would you pack? What would you do on your trip? What would you see?
* Look at a map together or draw one.
* Choose a country that your teen has never heard of and learn more about the country.
text:
* Awunakusoloko useluhambeni ngalo lonke ixesha, kodwa unako ukuba namaphupha! Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo le mibuzo:
* Ungathanda ukuthatha uhambo oluyaphi? Uza kuhamba ixesha elide kangakaani? Uza kupakisha njani? Yintoni onokuyenza kolo hambo? Yintoni onokuyibona?
Jongani kunye kwimephu okanye niyizobe.
* Khetha ilizwe angalaziyo umntwana wakho ofikisayo nize nifunde ngakumbi ngalo.

SourceText: You and your teenager can plan a guestlist of the famous people you’d most like to invite to your party. You can each have five people – they can be from the past or from the present time. Who would you invite? And would your guests get on well together?
text: Wena nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ningenza uluhlu lokuqikelela abantu abadumileyo belo lizwe neningathanda ukubamemela kwitheko lenu. Ngamnye kuni angamema abantu abahlanu – bangaba baphila kule mihla okanye babe ngabakudala. Ngoobani eninokubamema? Ngaba iindwendwe zingavana?

SourceText:
* Think of three statements about yourself. Two must be true and one must be a lie.
* It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example: I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing. 
* Say them to your teenager and ask them to guess which one is a lie. 
* Did they guess correctly? Was it a surprise?
* Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text:
* Cinga ngezinto ezintathu ezinokuthethwa ngawe. Ezimbini kuzo zimele zibe yinyani kwaye enye yazo ibe bubuxoki.
* Kunganceda ukucinga ngezinto ozinqwenelayo, amaphupha akho, amava asesikolweni, izinto ozithandayo okanye ongazithandiyo. Ngokomzekelo: Ndiyazicaphukela iibhanana, isifundo endisithandayo yisayensi kwaye ndikunqwenela kakhulu ukukwazi ukucula. 
* Zixelele umntwana wakho ofikisayo uze umbuze ukuba yeyiphi engoyonyani kwezi. 
* Ngaba uchanile xa ebeqashisela? Ngaba imothusile?
* Ngoku mcele enze into efanayo. Ikhona into entsha eniyifundileyo komnye nomnye?

SourceText: Tell your teenager something about when you were a teenager yourself. What things didn’t exist then? Phones with internet? What did you do for fun? What did you worry about? Don’t worry if they don’t tell you something in return – what’s important is that they listen and remember. Sometimes our teenagers forget that their parents are people too!
text: Balisela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngezinto zangokuya wawungangaye. Ziintoni ezazingekho ngoko? Ifowuni ezingena kwi-intanethi? Wawusenza ntoni xa uzonwabisa? Yintoni eyayikuxhalabisa? Ungabi naxhala xa bengathethi nto emva kokuba ubaxelele ngawe -– into ebalulekileyo kukuba bamamele kwaye baza kukhumbula. Ngamanye amaxesha, abantwana bethu abafikisayo bayalibala ukuba abazali babo nabo ngabantu!

SourceText:
* Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds. 
* Ask your teen, “If you had the superpower to […], how would you use it?”
* Encourage them to give their superhero a name and act it out. 
* Now let your teen choose a superpower for you.
* Make sure you act out your superpower, too!
text:
* Cinga ngokuba namandla angaphezu kwemvelo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuya naphi na ngoko nangoko, ukubuyela emva kwixesha lakudala. 
* Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba, “Xa ubunamandla angaphezu kwemvelo oku[...], ubungawasebenzisa njani?”
* Mkhuthaze ukuba anike eli qhawe linamandla angaphezu kwemvelo igama aze enze loo nto beliza kuyenza. 
* Ngoku cela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akukhethele amandla angaphezu kwemvelo onokuba nawo.
* Qinisekisa ukuba nawe uyabonisa ukuba ungawasebenzisa njani amandla akho nagaphezu kwemvelo!

SourceText:
Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.

It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…

Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text:
Ncokola kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nento ayithandayo.

Isenokuba yiyo nantoni na abakhetha ukuncokola ngayo: imidlalo, iitshomi, umculo, oosaziwayo.

Zama ukummamela umntwana wakho uze umvumele athethe.

SourceText:
* Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
* Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
* Storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
* When the story is finished, try with a different storyteller!
text:
* Khetha umntu obalisa ibali ukuze aqalise ukulibalisa.
* Abantu abalimameleyo bangasebenzisa naliphi igama ukuze bangenelele nanini na.
* Umntu obalisayo kufuneka asebenzise elo gama kwibali alibalisayo.
* Xa ibali ligqityiwe, makubalise omnye umntu.

SourceText:
* Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane.
* Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
* Ask them why?
* Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text:
* Cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezahlukahlukeneyo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuqhuba imoto, ukukhwela isikhitshana okanye ukubhabha ngenqwelo ntaka.
* Chazela umntwana wakho ngezi zinto uze umbuze, “Yeyiphi onokuyikhetha?”
* Mbuze ukuba kutheni ekhetha leyo?
* Ngoku cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezingakumbi okanye ucele umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwenzele.

SourceText:
* Ask each other questions. They can be any questions about things you like or what you did today.
* The only rule is that you can’t answer “Yes”, “No” or “Maybe”.
* How long can you last? How creative can you get with your answers?
* Swap over and play again!
text:
* Buzanani imibuzo. Ingayimibuzo emalunga nezinto ozithandayo okanye ozenzileyo namhlanje.
* Umthetho mnye qha kukuba awunakuphendula uthi, “Ewe” okanye “Hayi” okanye uthi, “Mhlawumbi.”
* Niza kuyenza kangangexesha elingakakani? Iimpendulo zakho zingacingisiswa kangakanani?
* Tshintshanani nize nidlale kwakhona!

SourceText:
* First person says, “On Saturday, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”
* Second person adds to first person, “On Saturday, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend).
* Each person adds to the previous, trying to think of all of the fun things to do on Saturday.
text:
* Umntu wokuqala uthi, “NgoMgqibelo ndiya...(umz., epakini)”
* Umntu wesibini wongeza kwinto ethethwe ngumntu wokuqala athi, “NgoMgqibelo ndiya epakini kwaye... (umz. ndiyokutyelela umhlobo wam osenyongweni).
* Umntu ngamnye wongezelela kwinto ethethwe ngumntu wokugqibela, nizama ukucinga ngazo zonke izinto ezimnandi ezinokwenziwa ngoMgqibelo.

SourceText:
* Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
* Let your teen make up the next sentence.
* Then you make up a sentence.
* Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
* Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
* Ask your teen what was their favourite part of the story!
text:
* Qalisa ibali ngokuthi, “Kudala kwaye kukho...”
* Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo athethe into elandelayo.
* Emva koko ugqibezela isivakalisi.
* Tshintshanani nide nibe nebali elitsha elimnandi.
* Qinisekisa ukuba ibali liphela kamnandi. *
Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba yeyiphi indawo ayithandileyo kwibali!

SourceText:
* Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat. 
* Prepare it together!    
* Let them have a turn at being the head chef – they lead, and you follow their instructions. 
* You can even help them to make a budget for the ingredients! 

Don’t think it will work? Ask your teens what THEY would like for you and them to do together. Let them lead. Relax. Have fun.
text:
Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba angathanda ukutya isidlo esinjani. 
* Senzeni nobabini!    
* Mvumele ibe nguye umpheki oyintloko – nguye okhokelayo kwaye wena ulandela imiyalelo yakhe. 
* Unokumnceda nokuba enze ibhajethi yezinto eziza kuthengwa xa kuphekwa! 

Ucinga ukuba ayizusebenza? Buza abantwana bakho abafikisayo ukuba BAFUNA ukuba nenze ntoni kunye. Bayeke bakhokele. Phola. Yonwaba.

SourceText:
* Create a set of dance moves to your teen's favourite songs. 
* One person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.  
* Everyone takes turns being the leader. 
* Perform it for the household!
text:
* Makujuxuzwe ngendlela athanda ukujuxuza ngayo umntwana wakho ofikisayo. 
* Umntu omnye uyajuxuza baze abanye balinganise yena.  
* Wonke umntu unetyeli lokukhokela. 
* Yenzani phambi kwakhe wonke umntu osekhayeni lenu!

SourceText:
* This game can be played in pairs or with many people in a group.
* Stand facing each other or in a circle. 
* One person leads first and everyone else copies them, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
* Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone else to follow! Explore moving different body parts and in different levels.
* After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
* Try it with no leaders!
text:
* Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa ngabantu ababini okanye ngabantu abaninzi kwiqela.
* Yimani isangqa nize nijongane. 
* Umntu omnye uyakhokela baze abanye bamlinganise bezama ukushukuma ngexesha elifanayo nenkokheli.
* Qinisekisa ukuba inkokheli ayikhawulezi ukuze abanye bakwazi ukuyilinganisa! Jongani amalungu omzimba ashukumayo ngamanqanaba ahlukahlukeneyo.
* Emva kwethutyana, tshintshani inkokheli. Wonke umntu makabe nethuba lokukhokela.
* Zamani zingekho iinkokheli!

SourceText: Praise time! Look at your teen and praise them for one thing they are doing well! And when was the last time you praised yourself or another adult in your household? Try it!
text: Lixesha lokuncoma! Jonga umntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye umncome ngento enye ayenza kakuhle! Ugqibele nini ukuzincoma okanye ukuncoma omnye umntu omdala ekhayeni lakho? Yizame!

SourceText:
* Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or your foot, juggling, making soup?
* Take turns in trying the new skill out.
* Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text:
* CInga ngesakhono esitsha onokusifunda kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuteka ibhola okanye ukuyibamba ngonyawo lwakho ingawi, ukujula iibhola phezulu uze uzibambe, ukwenza isuphu?
*Tshintshanani nize nizame ukwenza isakhono esitsha.
* Qinisekani ukuba niyancomana, nize nizame ukufunda nokudlala kunye!

SourceText:
* Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing.
* Pick one together and try it out. 
* If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
* Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text:
* Cingani ngeendlela ezintathu zokujima. Ngokomzekelo, ukuhamba, ukunkcunkca, ukudlala ibhola okanye ukudanisa.
* Khethani kunye ibe nye nize niyizame. 
* Ukuba nobabini niyayithanda, gqibani ngokuba niza kuyenza kangaphi. Kanye okanye kabini ngeveki? Qho ngentseni?
* Ninobabini, cingani ngendlela yokuyenza ibe mnandi nangakumbi. Ningankcunkca niyokutsho kwindawo ethile? Mhlawumbi nitshintshisane ngokuba ngumqeqeshi? Nikhuthazane ngomvuzo omncinci wasimahla?

SourceText:
* The first person gets to choose or sing a song.
* Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder they can guess the singer).
* The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader.
text:
* Umntu wokuqala uza kukhetha ingoma okanye akhethe ukuyicula.
* Wonke omnye umntu umele aqashisele igama lengoma (ukuze niyeze ibe nzima, angaqashisela nomntu oyiculayo).
* Umntu wokuqala ukuqashisela ngokuchanileyo kuza kukhokela yena.

SourceText:
This game is best with at least 3 people.
* Start in a circle and pass one “snap” around the circle (or a “clap” if you cannot snap).
* You “snap” once to throw the “snap”, and once to catch it. Look at the person you are throwing it to.  
* The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.  
* You can bounce the “snap”, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.  
* When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing the “snap”.  
* Can you throw under the leg? Behind the back? Through your head? Intercept a pass? Have fun with the “snap”!
text:
Lo mdlalo umnandi ngakumbi xa kukho abantu aba-3 ubuncinane.
* Qalisani kwisangqa uze ugqithise “ibhola” kube kanye esangqeni (okanye “uqhwabe xa ungakwazi ukujula).
* “Ujula” kube kanye ukuze ujule “ibhola”, uze uyibambe kube kanye. Mjonge umntu omphoselayo.  
* Indlela oyiphosa ngayo (phezulu, ezantsi, ngqo, ngasecaleni, iqengqeleka phantsi) kunye namandla (ngamandla kakhulu, ngokuthambileyo) imele ichaphazele indlela ayibamba ngayo umntu.  
* Unokuyigqampisa “ibhola”, uyijule emoyeni uze uyibambe kambalwa ngaphambi kokuba uyidlulisele komnye umntu.  
* Xa umntu wonke sele eqhelene noku, unokuqalisa ukujikeleza kwigumbi usajula “ibhola”.  
* Ungakwazi ukuyijula ngaphantsi komlenze? Ngemva komqolo? Entla kwentloko yakho? Ukuyibamba ngaphambi kokuba ifike komnye umntu? Nikonwabele ukudlala “ngebhola”!

SourceText:
Choose a sport or exercise to do together. Decide on a schedule. Are you going to do it every day? For how long? 

Try it out for a week. At the end of the week, ask yourself and your family these questions:
* How is it going? 
* How did you feel at the start of the week? 
* How do you feel at the end of the week? 
* What can we do differently next week?
text:
Khethani umdlalo okanye indlela yokujima eninokuyenza kunye. Gqibani ngocwangciso. Ngaba niza kuyenza yonke imihla? Kangangexesha elingakanani? 

Yizameni kangangeveki. Ekupheleni kweveki, buza wena kunye nentsapho yakho le mibuzo:
* Ihamba njani? 
* Benivakalelwa njani ekuqaleni kweveki? 
* Nivakalelwa njani ekupheleni kweveki? 
* Yintoni esinokuyenza ngokwahlukileyo kwiveki ezayo?

SourceText:
Take turns being the “leader”. Say the intro sentences to activate everyone. Then the “leader” gives an instruction and everyone does the activity as fast as possible:
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Touch something red.” 
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Jump up and down ten times.”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “There’s a fire on the mountain!”        
* Together: “Run, run, run!”
* Leader: “Put the shoes in the shoe rack.”
text:
Tshintshanani ngokuba “yinkokheli”. Thethani amagama okuqala ukuze wonke umngu angene. Emva koko, “inkokheli” ikhupha umyalelo kwaye wonke umntu wenza loo nto ngokukhawuleza okunokwenzeka.
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Bamba into ebomvu.” 
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Xhuma, xhuma izihlandlo ezilishumi.”
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Kukho umlilo ezintabeni!”        
* Nonke: “Baleka, baleka, baleka!”
* Inkokheli: “Bekani izihlangu kwindawo ehlala izihlangu.”

SourceText:
This game is best when more than 2 people play.
* One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner. 
* Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
* The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”  
* The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?” 

The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text:
Lo mdlalo umnandi xa udlalwa ngabantu abangaphezu kwaba-2
* Umntu omnye wenza ngathi wenza into ethile – ngokomzekelo, ukama iinwele okanye upheka isidlo sangokuhlwa. 
* Omnye umntu ubuza athi, “Wenza ntoni?”
* Umntu wesibini kufuneka athethe into engadibaniyo nokukama iinwele, ngokomzekelo athi, “Ndibopha imitya yezihlangu zam”  
* Umntu wesibini uqalisa ukwenza ngathi ubopha imitya yezihlangu zakhe de omnye umntu ambuze, “Wenza ntoni?” 

Impendulo kufuneka isoloko ingeyiyo le nto ayenzayo loo mntu!

SourceText:
* Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
* Do it as fast and loud as you can.
* Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with both feet.
* Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
* Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text:
* Vuthululani izandla zenu zasekhohlo emoyeni izihlandlo ezi-8 ngoxa nibala ukuya kutsho ku-8.
* Yenzani ngokukhawuleza kwaye ningxola kangangoko ninako.
* Phindani nangesinye isandla. Phindani ngeenyawo zombini.
* Yenzani kasi-7, emva koko kasi-6 nize niqhubeke nide nifike ku-1.
* Wonke umntu ukhwaza athi “Inkukhu ephambeneyo” emva koko nidanise ngathi yinkukhu ephambeneyo!

SourceText:
Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. 

Notice how you feel. 

When you are ready, open your eyes again.
text:
Hlalani phantsi, valani amehlo enu nize nimamele indlela eniphefumla ngayo njengoko nitsala nize nikhuphe umoya. 

Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo. 

Xa sele ukulungele, phinda uvule amehlo akho.

SourceText: Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text: Kuzameni oko nanini na niziva nixinezelekile kwaye nifuna ikhefu ukuze niphinde ninxibelelane neziqu zenu.

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Let's use the magic power of three to stay present and relax. 

Name three sounds you can hear right now. 
Name three smells you can smell right now. 
Name your three favourite foods. 

What are three things you can be grateful for right now? They don't have to be big.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Masisebenzise amandla amangalisayo enani elinguntathu ukuze sihlale silapha size siphole. 

Chaza izandi ezintathu ozivayo ngoku. 
Chaza amavumba amathathu owevayo ngoku. 
Chaza izidlo ezithathu ozithanda kakhulu. 

Zeziphi izinto ezintathu onombulelo ngazo ngoku? Akunyanzelekanga ibe zizinto ezinkulu.

SourceText: At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text: Emva kosuku olunzima, ukucinga ezi zinto zintathu esinombulelo ngazo kungasinceda sibe nesibindi sokuzama kwakhona ngomso.

SourceText:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name 1 thing that you are grateful for. 
Name 1 thing that you did well. 
Name 1 thing that you love.
text:
Vala amehlo akho uze ucinge ngosuku olulandelayo. 

Chaza into e-1 onombulelo ngayo. 
Chaza into e-1 oyenze kakuhle. 
Chaza into e-1 oyithandayo.

SourceText: Well done, you are a hero!
text: Usebenzile, uliqhawe!

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Sebenzisa amandla amangalisayo enani elinguntathu ukuze sihlale silapha size siphole.

Phefumla uze ubale uyo kutsho kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uphele kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uyo kutsho kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3. 
Phefumla uze ubale uphele kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText:
Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

You are a star!
text:
Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo? Ukutsala umoya kunceda wonke umzimba kunye nengqondo yethu ukuba zizole. 

Ungu ngqa phambili!

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out five times.

Notice how you feel.
text:
Vala amehlo akho.

Mamela njengoko utsala uze ukhuphe umoya kahlanu.

Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo.

SourceText: When you are ready open your eyes again. You are in control!
text: Xa sele ukulungele, phinda uvule amehlo akho. Nguwe olawulayo!”

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Take a minute to think about the day.

Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.  
Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Thatha umzuzu ucinge ngosuku lwakho.

Cinga ngento ekhuthazayo okanye emnandi oye wayenza.
ZIncome ngokwenza into enye kakuhle namhlanje. 
Cinga ngento enye onokuyenza ngendlela eyahlukileyo ngomso.  
Cinga ngento enye onombulelo ngayo.

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? 

Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breath in and out slowly 5 times. 

Then try responding in a calmer way.
text:
Vala amehlo akho. 

Ngaba abantwana bakho bakhe bakwenze ngathi ufuna ukukrasa? 

Zinike unqumamo lwemizuzwana eli-10. Tsala uze ukhuphe umoya ucotha amatyeli ama-5. 

Emva koko zama ukusabela uzolile.

SourceText: Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Izigidi zabazali bathi oku kuyanceda - KAKHULU.

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.   

What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?  
What is one thing that brings you happiness?  
What is one thing that you love?  

They don't have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text:
Vala amehlo akho.  

Thatha umzuzu uze uyeke into oyenzayo ukuze unxibelelane nokuphefumla kwakho.   

Yeyiphi into enye onombulelo ngayo ngoku?  
Yeyiphi into enye ekwenza wonwabe?  
Yeyiphi into enye oyithandayo?  

Akunyanzelekanga ibe zizinto ezinkulu. Ngamanye amaxesha izinto ezincinci ebomini zezona zibaluleke kakhulu!

SourceText:
Here's an activity to relax your body:  

Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can.  
Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.   
Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?   
Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe in to the area and when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.   
Do this for a few breaths.   

Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?
text:
Nantsi into yokwenza umzimba wakho uphole:  

Hlala kwindawo entofontofo uze uvale amehlo akho ukuba unako.  
Yiba nombono weringi yegolide iskena umzimba wakho wonke, ukusuka ezinyaweni zakho ukuya entloko.   
Nikela ingqalelo njengoko isehla inyuka kumzimba wakho. Ngaba zikhona indawo ezingathi ziqinile? Zindindisholo? Zibuhlungu?   
Nikela ingqalelo kwezo ndawo okomzuzwana. Tsalela umoya kuloo ndawa uze xa uphefumla, uzame ukukhupha nayiphi intlungu okanye ukuqinia.   
Kwenze oku ngokuphefumla kambalwa.   

Vula amehlo akho. Uvakalelwa njani ngoku umzimba wakho?

SourceText: You can also try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text: Xa ungqengqe ebhedini yakho ibe ubuthongo bungehli, ungayizama le nto!

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you.  
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body don’t?   
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool.  
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.
text:
Vala amehlo akho.  

Phawula indlela onxibelelene ngayo kunye nomhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho.  
Ngawaphi amalungu omzimba wakho achukumisa umhlaba? Ngawaphi angawuchukumisiyo?   
Phawula apho kufudumele khona nalapho kubanda khona.  
Yiva umhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho nokuxhasayo. Vumela umzimba wakho wehle ukuze uxhaswe ngumhlaba.

SourceText: Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!
text: Zama ukwenza le nto xa usenza izinto ezingabalulekanga ezifana nokuhlamba izitya. Kungakunceda kakhulu!

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Hlala phantsi uze uvale amehlo akho.
Zingaphi izandi ozivayo?  
Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho. 
Emva kwemizuzwana elishumi, mingaphi iminwe oyibambileyo? Uve izandi ezingaphi? 

Zama kwakhona kangangemizuzwana elishumi.  
Ngaba uve izandi ezintsha? Zikhona izandi ozivileyo ngaphakathi komzimba wakho? 
Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo ngoku.

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Do you every feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?  

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.  
It’s ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.  

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?  
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?
text:
Vala amehlo akho.  

Ngaba uva into ngamandla kangangokuba ufuna ukuyibaleka?  

Endaweni yokubhekela kuloo mvakalelo, makhe sisondele kuyo okomzuzwana.  
Kulungile. Vala amehlo akho ukuba uziva ukhululekile. Tsala umoya kakhulu.  

Funa ukwazi. Uva ndawoni emzimbeni wakho? Ngaba kushushu okanye kuyabanda? Kuqinile okanye kuthambile? Kubambekile okanye Kukhululekile?  
Zibuze imibuzo. Indixelela ntoni? Ifuna ntoni? Ndingazibonisa njani ububele ngoku?

SourceText:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:   

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?   

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.
text:
Nantsi into emnandi enokukunceda uyeke ukuba noxinezeleko:   

Khetha ingoma ebonisa into oyifunayo ngoku. Ngaba ufuna ingoma ezolileyo ukuze ipholise umphefumlo wakho odiniweyo okanye ingoma edlamkileyo ukuze ikwenze ukhuphe uxinezeleko lwakho?   

Shenxisa izinto ukuze kubekho indawo yokujuxuzela umculo. Ungalibali ukuphefumla xa ushukuma. Ukuphefumla kunye nokushukuma kwakho makuhambelane.

SourceText: Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text: Nkqu nemizuzwana embalwa yokushukuma inganela ukuba ukhuphe uxinezeleko uze uzive ngcono!

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  
Take a moment to feel the ground under your feet. 
Think of something you feel grateful for.
Focus on your breath.
Breathe in and out.

In and out.
text:
Vala amehlo akho.  
Thatha ithuba ukuze uve umhlaba ongaphantsi kweenyawo zakho. 
Cinga ngento oziva unombulelo ngayo.
Nikela ingqalelo kwindlela ophefumla ngayo.
Tsala uze ukhuphe umoya.

Wutsale uze uwukhuphe.

SourceText:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.
text:
Molo! Uziva njani ngoku? Wonwabile, udakumbile, unomsindo, uchulumancile, unexhala?

Phawula ukuba uyiva ndawoni emzimbeni wakho. Phawula iingcinga ezihambelana naloo mvakalelo. Tsala umoya kakhulu.

SourceText: Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!
text: Zibulele ngokuthatha ixesha lokuva iimvakalelo kunye nokwazi iingcinga zakho!

SourceText:
Let’s practice a calming trick that we call ‘Pause Power’. 

Plant your feet on the ground and breathe in and out three times as slowly as you can. Imagine you are smelling a flower or blowing out a candle. 

Ta Da! Pause Power!
text:
Masiziqhelanise necebiso esiza kulibiza, “Amandla Onqumamo”. 

Beka iinyawo zakho emhlabeni uze uphefumlele ngaphakathi nangaphandle kathathu ibe ucotha kangangoko unako. Yiba nombono unukisa intyatyambo okanye uvuthela ikhandlela. 

Nantso ke! Amandla Onqumamo!

SourceText: This is a great trick to use when you are feeling frustrated because it will help to calm you down.
text: Eli licebiso elihle onokulisebenzisa xa uziva ucaphuka kuba lingakunceda uzole.

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Ukuzincoma kungaluncedo kakhulu, ingakumbi ngeentsuku ekunzima ngazo. 

Cinga ngeveki yakho uze ugqibezele esi sivakalisi: “Kule veki, ndiyazingca ngokuba...” Ingayiyo nantoni na emalunga nokuba ngumzali!

Cinga ngento enye oyenze kakuhle namhlanje. Ngoku, thatha iingalo zakho uze UZANGE!

SourceText:
Sit comfortably and close your eyes. 

Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?

Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:

May I be peaceful.
May I be safe.
May I be healthy.
May I be happy.
May there be love in my family.
May I feel loved.
text:
Hlala kwindawo entofontofo uze uvale amehlo akho. 

Qonda ukuba kwenzeka ntoni kuwe ngeli thuba. Ucinga ntoni? Ngaba iingcinga zakho ziyakhuthaza okanye ziyadakumbisa. Uvakalelwa njani? Uvakalelwa kamnandi okanye kakubi? Uvakalelwa njani umzimba wakho? Ngaba uziva uwubambile umzimba okanye upholile?

Nxibelelana nentlziyo yakho ngendlela enobubele. Usenokufuna ukubeka isandla sakho phezu kwentliziyo okanye kwesifuba sakho. Zixelele la mazwi:

Kwanga ndinganoxolo.
Kwanga ndingakhuseleka.
Kwanga ndingasempilweni.
Kwanga ndingonwaba.
Kwanga kungakho uthando kwintsapho yam.
Kwanga ndingaziva ndithandwa.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text: Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge ngamava akho. Phawula ukuba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo.

SourceText:
Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath. 

Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.

Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room. 

Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.
text:
Inyathelo 1. Vala amehlo akho uze utsale umoya kakhulu. 

Inyathelo 2. Khawuzibuze, “Ndicinga ngantoni?” Phawula enoba iingcinga zakho ziyakhuthaza okanye ziyadakumbisa.
Phawula ukuba uziva njani ngokweemvakalelo. Phawula enoba iimvakalelo zakho zintle okanye azintlanga. ZIkhumbuze ukuba enoba uvakalelwa njani, kulungile oko.
Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo umzimba wakho. Phawula ukuba kukho indawo ebuhlungu okanye eqinileyo.

Inyathelo 3. Nikela ingqalelo kwindlela ophefumla ngayo. Yiva umphefumlo wakho njenjoko ungena uze uphume. Unokubeka isandla esiswini sakho uze usive sinyuka size sehle njengoko uphefumla. Kwenze oku njengoko uphefumla kali-10.

Inyathelo 4. Yandisa ukwazi umzimba wakho wonke. Mamela izandi zegumbi. 

Inyathelo 5. Thatha ithutyana ukuze unikele ingqalelo enoba uzive ngendlela eyahlukileyo na. Xa sele ukulungele, vula amehlo akho.

SourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause. You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your Children!
text: Usebenzile Ngokuthatha Unqumamo. Ungakwenza oku nanini na uziva uxinezelekile. Kukunika ithuba lokuba uzole nangakumbi. Nokuba kukutsala umoya kakhulu izihlandlo ezimbalwa okanye kukunxibelelana nomhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho, oko kwenza umahluko. Unako nokuThatha Unqumamo kunye Nabantwana bakho!

SourceText:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

Let your hand hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

Relax your arms and let your arms to swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text:
Yima uze wolule iingalo zakho ziye phezulu. Tyhala nawaphi na amafu uze uvumele ilanga libe phezu kwakho. Yolula amacala akho omabini. Zolule ngaphambili nangasemva.

Beka izandla zakho emacaleni. Nyusa amagxa kancinci aye ngasezindlebeni njengoko uphefumla, nciphisa amehlo akho uze ubambe umoya wakho. Yeka amagxa akho njengoko umzimba wakho uphola.

Yekelela iingalo zakho uze izibeke ecaleni kwaye ujike nomzimba wakho wangasentla. Iingalo zakho mazibethe umqolo wakho kancinci njengeko ujika usiya kwelinye icala.

Beka unyawo phambi kolunye uze wenze izangqa ngamaqatha, ungalibali ukujikeleza kuwo omabini amacala. Unyawo ngalunye malwenze izangqa ezine kwicala ngalinye.

Ngoku xhumaxhuma ngokukhawuleza kangoko unako. Xhumela phezulu! Goba uye ezantsi! Zivocavoce ujikelezisa isinqe!

Vala amehlo akho uze uphakamise iingalo zakho ucotha ziye entla kwentloko yakho njengoko utsala umoya. Thoba iingalo zakho ngokucotha zize zibe secaleni njengoko ukhupha umoya.

Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge ngamava akho.

SourceText: Well done! You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Usebenzile! Ungayenza le nto nanini na uziva ngathi ufuna ukukhupha uxinezeleko uze wenze ingqondo kunye nomzimba wakho zidlamke.

SourceText:
Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
* Listening to your favourite music
* Going for a walk (if allowed)
* Doing some exercise
* Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
* Calling up a friend
* Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
* Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
* Watching your favourite T.V. show

Pick one and do it today!
text:
Yenze uluhlu lwezinto ezisempilweni othanda ukuzenza. Nanga amanye amacebiso:
* Ukumamela ingoma oyithandayo
* Ukuhambahamba (ukuba kuvumelekile)
* Ukujima
* Ukusela ikomityi yeti uwedwa
* Ukufowunela itshomi yakho
* Ukucula, ukudanisa, ukuthandaza okanye ukufunda
* Ukuhlala elangeni uvale amehlo
* Ukubukela inkqubo oyithandayo ekwi-TV.

Khetha ibe nye namhlanje!

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Xa uzinyamekela, unyamekela abantwana bakho. Sonke kufuneka sinxibelelane. Zama ukuthetha nezihlobo, intsapho kunye nangeenethiweki ezaziwayo yonke imihla. Ukuba sekulithuba ugqibele ukufowunela umntu, kwenze ngoku oko!

SourceText:
Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?

Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text:
Cinga ngento ekwenza ube nomsindo. Kwenzeka xa kutheni oku? Udla ngokusabela njani?

Thintela ukuba nomsindo kwasekuqaleni. Lala okanye uphumle xa udiniwe. Zama ukutya xa ulambile. Cela umntu akuxhase xa uziva ngathi uwedwa.

SourceText:
Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text:
Ukulawula umsindo kunganzima. Thatha ikhefu xa uziva usiba nomsindo ngakubantwana bakho okanye omnye umntu.

Yiya kwenye indawo kangangemizuzu emi-5 uze ukwazi ukulawula iimvakalelo zakho. Ukuba kukhuselekile phandle, yiya khona. Uza kudlula kule nto!

SourceText: Customise for your needs
text: Tshintsha ngenxa yeemfuno zakho

SourceText:
The next questions about your parenting experiences will help us to get you the support you need.

Be honest. Remember that millions of parents feel like you do, and we all deserve support. You are not alone!
text:
Imibuzo elandelayo malunga namava akho okuba ngumzali aza kusinceda sikunike inkxaso oyifunayo.

Nyaniseka. Ukhumbule ukuba izigidi zabazali zivakalelwa ngale ndlela ovakalelwa ngayo kwaye sonke siyayifanelekela inkxaso. Awukho wedwa!

SourceText: It is hard to find time to have fun with your teenager.
text: Kunzima ukuba nexesha lokonwaba kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: How many days in the past week were you able to give them your attention and do something that they enjoyed with them?
text: Zingaphi iintsuku evekini apho ukwaziyo ukubanika ingqalelo yakho uze wenze into abayithandayo kunye nabo?

SourceText:
We know this is hard. We have added some helpful tips on how you can spend time with your teen to @global.my_tips (in the @global.parent_centre), so you can access it right away. 

Because @global.w_1on1 builds the foundation for all other parenting tools,  it will be the @global.weekly_workshop you receive next week!
text:
Siyayiqonda ukuba inzima le nto. Siye safaka amacebiso aluncedo ngendlela onokuchitha ngayo ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo @global.my_tips (kwi-@global.parent_centre), ukuze ukwazi ukuwafumana ngokukhawuleza. 

Ngenxa yokuba i-@global.w_1on1 isisiseko sazo zonke izixhobo zokuba ngumzali, iza kuba yi-@global.weekly_workshop oza kuyifumana kwiveki ezayo!

SourceText: @global.w_1on1_tools added to @global.my_tips
text: I-@global.w_1on1_tools ifakwe kwi-@global.my_tips

SourceText: Well done! Our next @global.weekly_workshop  will give you more ideas for this, as a foundation for all the other parenting tools. But you already have a great start!
text: Usebenzile! I-@global.weekly_workshop elandelayo iza kukunika amacebiso ngale nto, njengesiseko sazo zonke ezinye izixhobo zokuba ngumzali. Kodwa sele unesiqalo esihle!
note: The string @global.weekly_workshop should not be translated.

SourceText: In our busy lives it’s hard to focus on the positive.
text: Kubomi bethu obuxakekileyo, kunzima ukunikela ingqalelo kwizinto ezikhuthazayo.

SourceText: How many days in the past week have you praised your teen?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, uye wamncoma iintsuku ezingaphi umntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText:
Using this app shows us that you care about your teen. We have added some essential tools on how to use praise to @global.my_tips for quick access. You can find @global.my_tips in the @global.parent_centre .

In our @global.weekly_workshop on @global.w_praise, you will learn even more on how to use this skill well.
text:
Ukusebenzisa le app kubonisa ukuba umkhathalele umntwana wakho ofikisayo. Kwi-@global.my_tips siye safaka izixhobo ezibalulekileyo ngendlela onokuncoma ngayo ukuze ukhawuleze uzifikelele. Unokufumana i-@global.my_tips kwi-@global.parent_centre.

Kwi-@global.weekly_workshop nge-@global.w_praise, uza kufunda nangakumbi ngendlela yokusisebenzisa kakuhle esi sakhono.

SourceText: @global.w_praise_tools added to @global.my_tips
text: I-@global.w_praise_tools ifakwe kwi-@global.my_tips

SourceText: Wonderful that you are praising your teen! This helps them feel valued – your encouragement means a lot. In our @global.weekly_workshop on @global.w_praise, you will learn even more how to use this skill well.
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuba uyamncoma umntwana wakho ofikisayo! Oku kumnceda azive exatyiswa – ukumkhuthaza kwakho kutsho lukhulu. Kwi-@global.weekly_workshop nge-@global.w_praise, uza kufunda nangakumbi ngendlela yokusisebenzisa kakuhle esi sakhono.

SourceText: survey_welcome_a_3
text: survey_welcome_a_3

SourceText: This is a very stressful time for families.
text: Eli lixesha elibangela uxinezeleko kwiintsapho.

SourceText: How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, ngaba njengomzali/umnakekeli uye waziva uxinezelekile?

SourceText:
Great that this has been a good week!

We’ll remind you every day to relax, recognise and reward yourself, to help you continue to manage your stress and feel calm.
text:
Kuhle ukuva ukuba le veki ibintle!

Siza kukukhumbuza yonke imihla ukuba uphole, uziphawule uze uzivuze ukuze sikuncede uqhubeke ulawula uxinezeleko lwakho uze uzive uzolile.

SourceText:
Great that you felt calm most of the week! 

We’ll remind you every day to relax, recognise and reward yourself, to help you continue to manage your stress and feel calm.
text:
Kuhle ukuva ukuba ubukhulu becala evekini ubuziva uzolile! 

Siza kukukhumbuza yonke imihla ukuba uphole, uziphawule uze uzivuze ukuze sikuncede uqhubeke ulawula uxinezeleko lwakho uze uzive uzolile.

SourceText:
We understand how stressful life can be. We’ll remind you every day to relax, recognise and reward yourself, to help manage your stress and feel calmer.

We will learn more about managing stress in week 5 of the @global.weekly_workshops - but you can already access some helpful tools under @global.my_tips to get you started!
text:
Siyayiqonda indlela obunoxinezeleleko ngayo ubomi. Siza kukukhumbuza yonke imihla ukuba uphole, uziphawule uze uzivuze ukuze sikuncede uqhubeke ulawula uxinezeleko lwakho uze uzive uzolile.

Kwiveki 5 ye-@global.weekly_workshops, siza kufunda okungakumbi malunga nokulawula uxinezeleko – kodwa ukuze uqalise, unako ukufikelela kwizixhobo eziluncedo phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips!

SourceText: Sometimes our children make us really upset.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha, abantwana bethu bakhe basicaphukise.

SourceText: How many days in the past week did you shout, scream or yell at your teen?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku oye washawuta waza wabakrasela ngazo abantwana bakho?

SourceText: Well done. Brain science shows that controlling your anger improves your teen’s brain development. Be proud of yourself.
text: Usebenzile. Inzululwazi yengqondo ibonisa ukuba ukulawula umsindo wakho kuphucula ukukhula kwengqondo yomntwana wakho. Zingce.

SourceText:
Thank you for being honest. It can be so difficult to control our stress. To look after yourself and help you feel calmer when things get tough, we’ll remind you every day to relax, recognise and reward yourself. You matter!

We will learn more about managing stress in week 5 of the @global.weekly_workshops, but you can already access some helpful tools under @global.my_tips to get started.
text:
Enkosi ngokunyaniseka. Kukhe kube nzima kakhulu ukulawula uxinezeleko lwethu. Ukuze uzinyamekele size sikuncede uzive uzolile xa izinto zisiba nzima, siza kukukhumbuza yonke imihla ukuba uphole, uziphawule uze uzivuze. Ubalulekile!

Kwiveki 5 ye-@global.weekly_workshops, siza kufunda okungakumbi malunga nokulawula uxinezeleko, kodwa sele unako ukufikelela kwizixhobo eziluncedo phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips.

SourceText: Thank you for being honest. It can be so difficult to control our stress. We hope our stress management tools will be useful to you. You can already find them under @global.my_tips in the @global.parent_centre .
text: Enkosi ngokunyaniseka. Kukhe kube nzima kakhulu ukulawula uxinezeleko lwethu. Siyathemba ukuba izixhobo zethu zokulawula uxinezeleko ziza kuba luncedo kuwe. Unokuzifumana phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips kwi-@global.parent_centre.

SourceText: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families now.
text: Imali yenye yezona zinto zinkulu ezibangela uxinezeleko kwiintsapho ngoku.

SourceText: How many days in the past week have you worried or felt anxious about money?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku oye wanexhala ngazo okanye oye waziva unexhala ngemali?

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food?
text: Kwinyanga edlulileyo (iinstuku ezingama-30), zingaphi iintsuku oye waphelelwa ngazo yimali yokuthenga ukutya?

SourceText: Great. We have a @global.weekly_workshop on family budgeting that can help with money stress more generally, and reduce money-related arguments.
text: Kuhle. Sine-@global.weekly_workshop malunga nokwenza ibhajethi yosapho enokukunceda ngoxinezeleko lwemali ngokuthe jikelele kuze kunciphise iingxabano ezinxulumene nemali.
note: The string @global.weekly_workshop should not be translated.

SourceText:
Money stress can be overwhelming. 

We have a @global.weekly_workshop on family budgeting in five weeks, but you can already access some core family budgeting tips under @global.my_tips!
text:
Uxinezeleko ngemali lungabangela usindeke kakhulu. 

Kwiiveki ezintlanu sine-@global.weekly_workshop malunga nokwenza ibhajethi yosapho, kodwa phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips unako ukufikelela amanye amacebiso ayintloko malunga nokwenza ibhajethi!

SourceText: @global.w_money_tools added to @global.my_tips
text: I-@global.w_money_tools ifakwe kwi-@global.my_tips

SourceText: It is so stressful when children misbehave.
text: Xa abantwana begeza, oko kubangela uxinezeleko.

SourceText: In the past week, did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, ngaba abantwana bakho uye wabaqeqesha ngokubabetha, ukubabetha ezimpundu okanye ukubabetha ngesandla sakho okanye ngenye into efana noswazi okanye ibhanti?

SourceText: It is wonderful that you are responding calmly when your teen does something upsetting. They can learn so much from you!
text: Kuhle ukubona ukuba uyazola xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo esenza into ecaphukisayo. Ininzi into abanokuyifunda kuwe!

SourceText:
Thank you for being honest – and we’re sorry you’re having a difficult time with your teen. To look after yourselves and help you feel calmer when things get tough, we’ll remind you every day to relax, recognise and reward yourself. You matter!

We will learn more about managing stress in week 5 of the @global.weekly_workshops, but you can already access some helpful tools under @global.my_tips to get started.
text:
Enkosi ngokunyaniseka – kwaye sibuhlungu ngenxa yokuba unexesha elinzima kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Ukuze uzinyamekele size sikuncede uzive uzolile xa izinto zisiba nzima, siza kukukhumbuza yonke imihla ukuba uphole, uziphawule uze uzivuze. Ubalulekile!

Kwiveki 5 ye-@global.weekly_workshops, siza kufunda okungakumbi malunga nokulawula uxinezeleko, kodwa sele unako ukufikelela kwizixhobo eziluncedo phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips.

SourceText:
Thank you for being honest – and we’re sorry you’re having a difficult time with your teen. 

We hope our stress management tools will help you to feel calmer in hard situations. You can find them in your @global.parent_centre, under @global.my_tips .
text:
Enkosi ngokunyaniseka – kwaye sibuhlungu ngenxa yokuba unexesha elinzima kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. 

Siyathemba ukuba izixhobo zokulawula uxinezeleko ziza kukunceda uzive uzolile phantsi kweemeko ezinzima. Ungazifumana kwi-@global.parent_centre yakho, phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips .

SourceText:
Thank you for being honest – and we’re sorry you’re having a difficult time with your teen. 

We all feel overwhelmed sometimes, and using @global.parent_app is a great step to help you and your family!

Our materials have helped thousands of parents and families to be less stressed and have more positive time together. We are here to support you.
text:
Enkosi ngokunyaniseka – kwaye sibuhlungu ngenxa yokuba unexesha elinzima kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. 

Sonke sikhe sizive sisonganyelwa zizinto ngamanye amaxesha kwaye ukusebenzisa i-@global.parent_app linyathelo elihle lokukunceda kunye nentsapho yakho!

Izinto zethu zincede amawaka abazali kunye neentsapho zaye ziyeka ukuba noxinezeleko kwaye zaba nexesha elimnadi kunye. Silapha ukuze sikuxhase.
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText: @global.w_stress_tools added to @global.my_tips
text: I-@global.w_stress_tools ifakwe kwi-@global.my_tips

SourceText: It’s hard to keep track of your teenagers when they are becoming independent.
text: Kunzima ukuzazi kakuhle izinto ezenziwa ngaabatwana bakho abafikisayo njengoko baya bekhula ibe bezimela.

SourceText: How many days in the past week did you know what your teen was doing and who they were with?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku oye wayazi ngazo ukuba uphi umntwana wakho ofikisayo kwaye ukunye nabani?

SourceText: This is good to hear.
text: Kuhle ukuva oku.

SourceText: Were you in lockdown this week?
text: Ngaba beniphantsi kwemithetho yokuhlala ekhaya kule veki?

SourceText: How many days in a typical non-lockdown week do you know what your teen is doing and who they are with?
text: Zingaphi iintsuku kwiveki eqhelekileyo ekungekho mithetho yokuhlala endlwini oye wazi ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo wenza ntoni kwaye ukunye nabani na?

SourceText:
This is a real concern for parents everywhere. We’ll make sure you get support with building communication. 

We’ll talk more about planning for your teen’s safety later in the @global.weekly_workshops, but you can already access some first core tips to keep your teen safe under @global.my_tips!
text:
Oku kuxhalabisa bonke abazali nokuba baphi. Siza kuqinisekisa ukufumana inkxaso yokukwazi ukunxibelelana. 

Siza kuthetha ngakumbi malunga nokuceba ukhuseleko lomntwana wakho ofikisayo kwi-@global.weekly_workshops, kodwa phantsi kwe-@global.my_tips unokufikelela kumacebiso aphambili ukuze ugcine umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile!

SourceText: @global.w_safe_tools added to @global.my_tips
text: I-@global.w_safe_tools ifakwe kwi-@global.my_tips

SourceText: This is really great. Parenting is hard, but you’re really succeeding in this.
text: Oku kuhle ngeyona ndlela. Ukuba ngumzali kunzima, kodwa uphumelela kakhulu kule nto.

SourceText: We all want to keep our children safe.
text: Sonke sifuna abantwana bethu bahlale bekhuselekile.

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you talk with your teen about keeping safe from sexual violence online or offline?
text: Kwinyanga ephelileyo (iintsuku ezingama-30), zingaphi iintsuku oye wacokola ngazo kunye nomntwana wakho malunga nokukhuseleka kubundlobongela ngokwesini enoba ukwi-intanethi okanye ekuhlaleni?

SourceText: This could be when they are going out with friends, or talking about the websites they use.
text: Kusenokwenzeka xa bekunye neetshomi zabo okanye bethetha ngeewebhsayithi abazisebenzisayo.

SourceText:
Being a parent is not easy. It can be difficult to know how to keep our teens safe. We often feel powerless as parents in this, but we are here to support you! You can get focused tools, extra content and resources on this in the @global.parent_centre at any time. 

We’ll also unlock the @global.weekly_workshops on rules and safety planning, which help with this – they'll be available for you anytime.
text:
Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Kunokubanzima ukwazi indlela yokugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile. Njengabazali, siye singabi nawo amandla kulo mbandela, kodwa sikhona ukuze sikuxhase! Kwi-@global.parent_centre ungafikelela kwizixhobo ezithetha ngqo ngalo mbandela, umxholo owongezelelekileyo kunye nezixhobo enokuba kunini na. 

Siza kuvula i-@global.weekly_workshops emalunga nemithetho kunye nokucebela ukhuseleko, enokukunceda ngoku – ziza kufumaneka kuwe nanini a.

SourceText: @global.weekly_workshops @global.w_rules and @global.w_safe unlocked
text: I-@global.weekly_workshops @global.w_rules kunye ne-@global.w_safe zivuliwe

SourceText:
Being a parent is not easy. It can be difficult to know how to keep our teens safe. We often feel powerless as parents in this, but we are here to support you! You can get focused tools, extra content and resources on this in the @global.parent_centre at any time. 

We’ll also unlock the @global.weekly_workshop on rules, which help with this – they'll be available for you anytime.
text:
Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Kunokubanzima ukwazi indlela yokugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile. Njengabazali, siye singabi nawo amandla kulo mbandela, kodwa sikhona ukuze sikuxhase! Kwi-@global.parent_centre ungafikelela kwizixhobo ezithetha ngqo ngalo mbandela, umxholo owongezelelekileyo kunye nezixhobo enokuba kunini na. 

Siza kuvula i-@global.weekly_workshop emalunga nemithetho nenokukunceda ngoku – ziza kufumaneka kuwe nanini a.

SourceText: @global.weekly_workshops @global.w_rules unlocked
text: I-@global.weekly_workshops @global.w_rules ivuliwe

SourceText:
Being a parent is not easy. Well done for focusing on keeping your teen safe. 

We’ll have more support for you on this in the later @global.weekly_workshops if you’d like to know even more!
text:
Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Usebenzile ngokunikela ingqalelo ekugcineni umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile. 

Kwi-@global.weekly_workshops ezizayo siza kuba nenkxaso engakumbi, ukuba ungathanda ukwazi okungakumbi!
note: The string @global.weekly_workshops should not be translated.

SourceText: We have a new challenge now – keeping our teenagers safe from COVID-19.
text: Ngoku sinocelo-mngeni olutsha – ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile kwi-COVID-19.

SourceText: How many days last week did your teenager stay safe through wearing a mask, keeping a distance from people and keeping away from crowded places?
text: Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku aye wakhuseleka ngazo umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngokuthi anxibe imaski, angasondelelani nabanye abantu nokungayi kwiindawo ezinabantu abaninzi?

SourceText: It can be challenging to keep your teen safe in COVID! We are putting together some advice - you will soon be able to access it in the @global.parent_centre .
text: Kungalucelo-mngeni ukugcina umntwana wakho ekhuselekile kwi-COVID! Sisaqulunqa amacebiso – kungekudala uza kuwafumana kwi-@global.parent_centre .
note: The string @global.parent_centre should not be translated.

SourceText: That’s great. We are putting together some advice for keeping your teen safe in COVID - you will soon be able to access it in the @global.parent_centre .
text: Kuhle oko. Sisaqulunqa amacebiso okugcina umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekhuselekile kwi-COVID – kungekudala uza kuwafumana kwi-@global.parent_centre .
note: The string @global.parent_centre should not be translated.

SourceText: Thank you for being honest
text: Enkosi ngokunyaniseka

SourceText: Content unlocked by these questions is now accessible in the @global.weekly_workshops
text: Umxholo ovulwa yile mibuzo uyafumaneka ngoku kwi-@global.weekly_workshops
note: The string @global.weekly_workshops should not be translated.

SourceText: You have just unlocked the first workshop!
text: Usanda kuvula uqeqesho lokuqala!

SourceText:
Every parent in the world is struggling in these hard times. These quick questions will fit this app to your needs.

Be honest. Remember that you are not alone! Millions of parents feel like you do, and we all deserve support.
text:
Wonke umzali osehlabathini uyasokola ngala maxesha obunzima. Le mibuzo emifutshane iza kwenza le app ifanele iimfuno zakho.

Nyaniseka. Khumbula ukuba awukho wedwa! Izigidi zabazali zivakalelwa ngale ndlela uvakalelwa ngayo kwaye sonke siyayidinga inkxaso.

SourceText: Let’s start with a few questions about you and your family.
text: Masiqale ngemibuzo embalwa malunga nawe kunye nentsapho yakho.

SourceText: We would love to know your first name or nickname:
text: Singathanda ukwazi igama okanye isiteketiso sakho:

SourceText: Are you a lady or a gentleman?
text: Ngaba uyindoda okanye ulibhinqa?

SourceText: Lady
text: Libhinqa

SourceText: Gentleman
text: Yindoda

SourceText: How old are you?
text: Mingaphi iminyaka yakho?

SourceText: Adults
text: Abantu abadala

SourceText: Teens
text: Abantwana Abafikisayo

SourceText: Children
text: Abantwana

SourceText: Babies
text: Iintsana

SourceText: How many people are in your household?
text: Bangaphi abantu abahlala ekhayeni lakho?

SourceText: You can do the @global.weekly_workshops by yourself OR you can invite some other family members or friends to join you - you will learn a lot from each other. It's up to you!
text: Unokuzenzela i-@global.weekly_workshops OKANYE unokumema amanye amalungu entsapho okanye izihlobo zikujoyine – uza kufunda into eninzi komnye nomnye. Kuxhomekeke kuwe!
note: The string @global.weekly_workshops should not be translated.

SourceText: How would you like to do your @global.weekly_workshops?
text: Ungathanda ukuyenza njani i-@global.weekly_workshops yakho?
note: The string @global.weekly_workshops should not be translated.

SourceText: Can you think of a name for your group?
text: Ngaba ungacinga ngegama leqela lakho?

SourceText: Which day of the week would you like to do your @global.weekly_workshops?
text: Loluphi usuku lweveki ongathanda ukwenza ngalo i-@global.weekly_workshops yakho?
note: The string @global.weekly_workshops should not be translated.

SourceText: Monday
text: NgoMvulo

SourceText: Tuesday
text: NgoLwesibini

SourceText: Wednesday
text: NgoLwesithathu

SourceText: Thursday
text: NgoLwesine

SourceText: Friday
text: NgoLwesihlanu

SourceText: Saturday
text: NgoMgqibelo

SourceText: Sunday
text: NgeCawa

SourceText: Great! We will unlock a new workshop for your group every week on @local.@local.combo_box . This allows all of you to try what you learned with your families before building the next skill.
text: Kulunge kakhulu! Qho ngeveki, siza kuvulela iqela lakho uqeqesho olutsha ku-@local.@local.combo_box . Oku kuza kuvumela ukuba nonke nizame izinto enizifunde kunye neentsapho zenu ngaphambi kokuba nifunde isakhono esilandelayo.
note: The string @local.combo_box should not be translated.

SourceText: Great! We will unlock a new workshop for you every week on @local.@local.combo_box . This allows you to try what you learned with your family before building the next skill.
text: Kulunge kakhulu! Qho ngeveki, siza kukuvulela uqeqesho olutsha ku-@local.@local.combo_box . Oku kuza kuvumela ukuba uzame izinto ozifunde kunye nentsapho yakho ngaphambi kokuba ufunde isakhono esilandelayo.
note: The string @local.combo_box should not be translated.

SourceText: You can always change these settings in your @global.weekly_workshop_options .
text: Unako ukutshintsha olu lungiso nanini na kwi-@global.weekly_workshop_options yakho.
note: The string @global.weekly_workshop_options should not be translated.

SourceText: Great!
text: Kulunge kakhulu!

SourceText:
I know life can be hard. I’m proud of you. 

Whatever you are feeling, it’s great that you are here!
text:
Ndiyayazi ubomi bunokubanzima. Ndiyazingca ngawe. 

Nokuba uvakalelwa njani, kuhle ukuba ulapha!

SourceText: Using the app together
text: Ukusebenzisa i-app kunye

SourceText:
It’s great to see you!

First, let’s help your group get started.
text:
Kuhle ukukubona!

Okokuqala, masincede iqela lakho liqalise.

SourceText:
Agree on your ground rules together:
* Which day(s)/time(s) will we meet in the week?
* Who will hold the phone(s) during our activities?
* How can we make sure everyone can share freely?
* What can we do so we all feel respected?
text:
Okokuqala vumelanani ngemithetho ebalulekileyo:
* Zeziphi iintsuku/amaxesha esiza kudibana ngawo evekini?
* Ngubani oza kubamba ifowuni xa sisenza izinto?
* Yintoni esinokuyenza ukuze siqiniseke ukuba wonke umntu uthetha ngokukhululekileyo?
* Yintoni esinokuyenza ukuze sonke sizive sihlonitshwa?

SourceText: You always can change your workshop day and your group name in the @global.weekly_workshop_options .
text: Unako ukulitshintsha nanini na usuku loqeqesho lwenu kunye negama leqela lakho kwi-@global.weekly_workshop_options.
note: The string @global.weekly_workshop_options should not be translated.

SourceText:
You are a star! 

Every day, recognise something you have done well. Reward yourself with something that makes you happy. And take a deep breath to relax. 

Remember, you earn a @global.parent_point every time you care for yourself - you matter!
text:
Ungu ngqa phambili! 

Yonke imihla, khumbula into oyenze kakuhle. Zivuze ngokuzenzela into ekwenza wonwabe. Tsala umoya ukuze uphole. 

Ukhumbule ukuba ufumana i-@global.parent_point qho uzikhathalela - ubalulekile!
note: The string @global.parent_point should not be translated.

SourceText:
Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our children never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Ukuba ngumzali kunganzima kakhulu. Ngamanye amaxesha kubonakala ngathi abantwana bethu abasimameli.

Kodwa inzululwazi ibonisa ukuba ukuchitha imizuzu embalwa ngosuku ngalunye nichitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo oko kunganceda ekwakheni ukuthembana nothando.

SourceText:
One-on-one time is when you focus on them, without TV or phones. Let them lead what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can do twenty minutes a day, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Ithuba lokuchitha ixesha ndawonye lelokunikela ingqalelo kubo, kungabukelwanga i-TV okanye kusetyenziswa iifowuni. Bavumele bakhokele into eyenziwayo okanye into enincokola ngayo.

Kuhle ukuba unokuchitha imizuzu engamashumi amabini ngosuku, kodwa nokuba yimizuzu emihlanu ngosuku oko kulungile.

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them. 

Remember, a family with good understanding live in harmony.
text:
Molo.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ngowokuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu.

Kubalulekile ukuchitha ixesha kunye nabantwana bethu ukuze basazi kakuhle nokuba nathi sibe nethuba lokubazi kakuhle. 

Ukhumbule ukuba intsapho eyazana kakuhle iyavisisana.

SourceText:
* Ideas for one-on-one time
* Tools: How to spend one-on-one time
DAY - PLAY - STAY
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Amacebiso okuchitha ixesha ndawonye
* Izixhobo: Indlela yokuchitha ixesha lenu nobabini
USUKU - UKUDLALA - UKUHLALA
* Amacebiso asebenzisekayo ekhaya

SourceText:
* Self-care activities
* Ideas for one-on-one time
* Tools: How to spend one-on-one time
DAY - PLAY - STAY
* Home practice suggestions
text:
* Izinto zokwenza xa uzinyamekela
* Amacebiso okuchitha ixesha ndawonye
* Izixhobo: Indlela yokuchitha ixesha lenu nobabini
USUKU - UKUDLALA - UKUHLALA
* Amacebiso asebenzisekayo ekhaya

SourceText:
Share ideas! 

What are things you could do to spend one-on-one time with your teens?

Feel like you have NO TIME and you are exhausted? Come up with ideas for one-on-one time that do not take up extra time, like walking to the shop together.
text:
Yabelalani ngamacebiso! 

Zeziphi izinto onokuzenza xa uchitha ixesha ndawonye kunye nabantwana bakho abafikisayo?

Ngaba uziva ngathi AWUNALO ixesha ibe udinwe uyimfe? Cinga ngezinto zokwenza xa nichitha ixesha ndawonye ezingatyi xesha elingakumbi njengokuhamba niye evenkileni kunye.

SourceText:
It may take some time to get used to one-on-one time, but the more you do it the better it gets!

You are amazing parents for trying this.
text:
Kungathatha ixesha ukuqhelana nokuchitha ixesha ndawonye, kodwa okukhona ukwenza, kokukhona kusiba ngcono!

Ningabazali abaphum’izandla ngokuzama le nto.

SourceText: Let's think of ways to spend one-on-one time with your teen.
text: Makhe sicinge ngeendlela zokuchitha ixesha ndawonye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: What could you do to spend one-on-one time with your teen?
text: Yitoni onokuyenza ngethuba lokuchitha ixesha ndawonye kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo?

SourceText: Feel like you have NO TIME and you are exhausted? Remember to also think of ways that do not take up extra time.
text: Ngaba uziva ngathi AWUNALO ixesha ibe udinwe uyimfe? Ungalibali ukucinga ngezinto ezingazukufuna ixesha elongezelelekileyo.

SourceText:
It may take some time to get used to one-on-one time, but the more you do it the better it gets!

You are an amazing parent for trying this.
text:
Kungathatha ixesha ukuqhelana nokuchitha ixesha ndawonye, kodwa okukhona ukwenza, kokukhona kusiba ngcono!

Ungumzali ophum’izandla ngokuzama le nto.

SourceText: DAY - Try to do it every day
text: USUKU - Zama ukuyenza yonke imihla

SourceText: Find 5 minutes (or more!) each day when your teen does not have something else they want to do.
text: Kusuku ngalunye, khangela imizuzu emi-5 (okanye ngakumbi!) xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo engenanto yimbi afuna ukuyenza.

SourceText: PLAY - Let your teen choose
text: DLALA - vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe

SourceText: Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but will come to enjoy this time with you!
text: Xelela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ungathanda ukuchitha ixesha kunye naye kwaye angakhetha into afuna yenziwe okanye afuna ukuncokola ngayo. Ekuqaleni usenokuyifumanisa ingaqhelekanga le nto, kodwa uza kuhamba alonwabele eli xesha aba kunye nawe ngalo!

SourceText: STAY - Focus on your teen
text: HLALA - Nikela ingqalelo kumntwana wakho ofikisayo

SourceText: Switch off TV and put aside phones. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.
text: Cima i-TV nize ningazisebenzisi iifowuni zenu. Mjonge umntwana wakho ofikisayo. Nqwala intloko okanye uthi “Ndiyakuva” ukuze ubonise ukuba unikele ingqalelo nyhani. Yamela into ayithethayo ungakhange umgwebe.

SourceText: One-on-one time with your teen can be fun for you, too! It might even make you feel less stressed.
text: Nawe ungalinandipha ithuba lokuchitha ixesha ndawonye kunye nomntwana wakho! Kusenokukwenza ude uzive lwehlile uxinezeleko.

SourceText: Spend 5-20 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen, every day you can this week.
text: Chitha imizuzu eyi-5 ukuya kweyi-20 ekuchitheni ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo ngazo zonke iintsuku okwazi ngazo kule veki.

SourceText:
Remember - whenever you can, relax, recognise and reward yourself. 

Care for yourself every day. You matter!
text:
Ukhumbule - nanini na unako, phola, qonda uze uzivuze. 

Zinyamekele usuku ngalunye. Ubalulekile!

SourceText: Fantastic! We are proud of you for all you have done over the past weeks.
text: Kuhle ngeyona ndlela! SIyazingca ngawe ngazo zonke izinto ozenzileyo kwezi veki zidlulileyo.

SourceText: We’re sorry it’s a difficult day. We are proud of you for all you have done over the past weeks.
text: Sibuhlungu yimini enzima le. SIyazingca ngawe ngazo zonke izinto ozenzileyo kwezi veki zidlulileyo.

SourceText: Well done!
text: Usebenzile!

SourceText:

This is a huge achievement. It shows such care for your family. 

Let’s celebrate you, and plan your future parenting support.
text:
SIVUYISANA NAWE! Uphumelele! Uye wakha izakhono ezili-11 zokuba ngumzali.

SourceText:

text:

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today’s topic is celebration and next steps.

It has been amazing, it has been wonderful having you on this journey. Today we are celebrating our journey together. 

Today we are celebrating all the learnings that we have learned throughout.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke.

Umxholo wanamhlanje ungokubhiyoza kunye namanyathelo alandelayo.

Bekumangalisa, bekumnandi ukuba kunye nawe kolu hambo. Namhlanje sibhiyozela uhambo lwethu kunye. 

Namhlanje sibhiyozela zonke izinto esizifundileyo kulo lonke uqeqesho.

SourceText: Today you will celebrate, look back and look ahead:
text: Namhlanje siza kubhiyoza, sijonge izinto ezidlulileyo size sikhangele phambili:

SourceText: Today you celebrate and reflect on your experiences.
text: Namhlanje uyabhiyoza uze ucinge ngamava akho.

SourceText: You and your family have learnt so much. Let's think back and see what has changed.
text: Wena nentsapho yakho nifunde into eninzi gqitha. Makhe sibuyele emva size sibone izinto ezitshintshileyo.

SourceText: Reflect with Sbo
text: Khawucinge kunye noSbo

SourceText:
Discuss together:
* What has changed in your family?
* What are you proud of that you have done?

Remember to praise and encourage each other!
text:
Ncokolani kunye:
* Yintoni etshintshileyo kwintsapho yakho?
* Zintoni onebhongo ngokuzenza?

Ningalibali ukuncoma kunye nokukhuthazana!

SourceText:
How will you support each other going forward? 

Here are some ideas from other families:
text:
Niza kuxhasana njani ukususela ngoku? 

Nanga amanye amacebiso avela kwezinye iintsapho:

SourceText: MEET
text: DIBANANI

SourceText: Keep meeting regularly to give each other parenting support.
text: Qhubekani nidibana rhoqo ukuze nixhasane njengabazali.

SourceText: CALL
text: FOWUNANI

SourceText: Be ‘parenting buddies’ to call when you are upset or don’t know what to do.
text: Yibani ngabazali ‘abazitshomi’ ukuze nifowunelane xa nikhathazekile okanye ningazi ukuba nenze ntoni.

SourceText: TEXT
text: THUMELA UMYALEZO

SourceText: Text each other every week to share what you’ve done well.
text: Thumelani umyalezo qho ngeveki ukuze nabelane ngezinto enizenze kakuhle.

SourceText: SHARE
text: YABELANANI

SourceText: Share @global.parent_app and help other families start their journey.
text: Yabelanani nge-@global.parent_app nize nincede ezinye iintsapho ziqale uhambo lwazo.
note: The string @global.parent_app should not be translated.

SourceText:
Plan how you will support each other going forward. 

You can use the ideas from other families, or make up your own!
text:
Cebani ngendlela eniza kuxhasana ngayo ukususela ngoku. 

Ningasebenzisa amacebiso avela kwezinye iintsapho okanye nizicingele awenu!

SourceText:
We are so proud of you. You have shown strength, courage, and love for your family. Parents are amazing. You are amazing. 

This song is for parents everywhere. Listen, dance together and celebrate yourselves!
text:
Siyazingca ngawe. Uye wabonakalisa amandla, isibindi kunye nokuyithanda intsapho yakho. Abazali bagqwesile. Uyamangalisa. 

Le ngoma yeyabazali nokuba baphi na. Mamela, danisani kunye nize nizibhiyozele!

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool.
text: Ukuzikhathalela sisixhobo esiphambili sokuba ngumzali.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Kuyavuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kamnandi namhlanje. Uyamangalisa!

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Uxolo ngokuba iimeko zinzima kanye ngoku. Tsala umoya uze uzazi ukuba uyaxatyiswa.

SourceText: @global.home_practice_problem_solving: @global.w_rules
text: @global.home_practice_problem_solving: @global.w_rules

SourceText:
You can help your teenager to understand that breaking family rules leads to consequences. 

But HOW you do this matters. 

Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer...
text:
Unganceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo ayiqonde ukuba kukho imiphumo xa engayithobeli imithetho yekhaya. 

Kodwa INDLELA okwenza ngayo oku ibalulekile. 

Ukunika imiphumo ngendlela efanelekileyo kunceda abantwana abafikisayo baziphathe kakuhle kuze kwenze ubomi bentsapho buzole...

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone. 

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist in us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Molweni, kuni nonke. 

Umxholo wanamhlanje kukunika umphumo uzolile.

Kubalulekile ukuba sibabandakanye abantwana bethu abafikisayo xa siza kusebenzisa imiphumo, kodwa kukwabaluleke nangakumbi ukuzola xa sibanika umphumo.

Oku kuza kusinceda sinike abantwana bethu umphumo sizolile kwaye bona baza kuyikhumbula lula xa bebandakanyekile ibe loo nto iza kwenza bathathe uxanduva.

SourceText: @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! What time is this? You are late!”
text: @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1! Ngubani ixesha ngoku? Ufike emva kwexesha!

SourceText:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “Sorry @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver – you can go back to sleep”.  

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “It is WAY past the time you were supposed to be home!”
text:

@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “I can explain, @global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, I can.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, you are not keeping our rule! I will give you a hiding!”
text:
@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1: “Ndingachaza,@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver, ndingakwazi.” 

@global.w_consequence_male_caregiver: “@global.w_consequence_teen_boy_1, awuwuthobeli umthetho walapha! Ndiza kukubetha”

* Why did giving a consequence this way not work well?
